00046 /*! Returns \e true if | \a a-b | < \a epsilon * | \a b |, else \e false. */
00047 template<typename F> inline bool approx (F a, F b, F epsilon=1e-5)
00048   {
00049   using namespace std;
00050   return abs(a-b) < (epsilon*abs(b));
00051   }
00052 
00053 /*! Returns \e true if | \a a-b | < \a epsilon, else \e false. */
00054 template<typename F> inline bool abs_approx (F a, F b, F epsilon=1e-5)
00055   {
00056   using namespace std;
00057   return abs(a-b) < epsilon;
00058   }
00059 
00060 /*! Returns the largest integer which is smaller than (or equal to) \a arg. */
00061 template<typename I, typename F> inline I ifloor (F arg)
00062   {
00063   using namespace std;
00064   return I(floor(arg));
00065   }
00066 
00067 /*! Returns the integer which is nearest to \a arg. */
00068 template<typename I, typename F> inline I nearest (F arg)
00069   { return ifloor<I>(arg+0.5); }
00070 
00071 /*! Returns \a v1+v2 if \a v1<0, \a v1-v2 if \a v1>=v2, else \a v1.
00072     \a v1 can be positive or negative; \a v2 must be positive. */
00073 template<typename T> inline T weak_modulo (T v1, T v2)
00074   { return (v1>=0) ? ((v1<v2) ? v1 : (v1-v2)) : (v1+v2); }
00075 
00076 /*! Returns the remainder of the division \a v1/v2.
00077     The result is non-negative.
00078     \a v1 can be positive or negative; \a v2 must be positive. */
00079 inline double fmodulo (double v1, double v2)
00080   {
00081   using namespace std;
00082   return (v1>=0) ? ((v1<v2) ? v1 : fmod(v1,v2)) : (fmod(v1,v2)+v2);
00083   }
00084 
00085 /*! Returns the remainder of the division \a v1/v2.
00086     The result is non-negative.
00087     \a v1 can be positive or negative; \a v2 must be positive. */
00088 template<typename I> inline I imodulo (I v1, I v2)
00089   { I v=v1%v2; return (v>=0) ? v : v+v2; }
00090 
00091 /*! Returns -1 if \a signvalue is negative, else +1. */
00092 template<typename T> inline T sign (const T& signvalue)
00093   { return (signvalue>=0) ? 1 : -1; }
00094 
00095 /*! Returns \a val*pow(-1,m) */
00096 template<typename T, typename I> inline T xpow (I m, T val)
00097   { return (m&1) ? -val : val; }

00099 template <typename I, bool g4> struct isqrt_helper__
00100   {};
00101 template <typename I> struct isqrt_helper__ <I, false>
00102   {
00103   static uint32 isqrt (I arg)
00104     {
00105     using namespace std;
00106     return uint32 (sqrt(arg+0.5));
00107     }
00108   };
00109 template <typename I> struct isqrt_helper__ <I, true>
00110   {
00111   static uint32 isqrt (I arg)
00112     {
00113     using namespace std;
00114     long double arg2 = static_cast<long double>(arg)+0.5;
00115     return uint32 (sqrt(arg2));
00116     }
00117   };
00118 
00119 /*! Returns the integer \a n, which fulfills \a n*n<=arg<(n+1)*(n+1). */
00120 template<typename I> inline uint32 isqrt (I arg)
00121   { return isqrt_helper__<I,(sizeof(I)>4)>::isqrt(arg); }
00122 
00123 /*! Returns the largest integer \a n that fulfills \a 2^n<=arg. */
00124 template<typename I> inline unsigned int ilog2 (I arg)
00125   {
00126   unsigned int res=0;
00127   while (arg > 0x0000FFFF) { res+=16; arg>>=16; }
00128   if (arg > 0x000000FF) { res|=8; arg>>=8; }
00129   if (arg > 0x0000000F) { res|=4; arg>>=4; }
00130   if (arg > 0x00000003) { res|=2; arg>>=2; }
00131   if (arg > 0x00000001) { res|=1; }
00132   return res;
00133   }
00134 
00135 /*! Returns \a atan2(y,x) if \a x!=0 or \a y!=0; else returns 0. */
00136 inline double safe_atan2 (double y, double x)
00137   {
00138   using namespace std;
00139   return ((x==0.) && (y==0.)) ? 0.0 : atan2(y,x);
00140   }

00142 /*! Helper function for linear interpolation (or extrapolation).
00143     The array must be ordered in ascending order; no two values may be equal. */
00144 template<typename T, typename Iter, typename Comp> inline void interpol_helper
00145   (const Iter &begin, const Iter &end, const T &val, Comp comp, tsize &idx,
00146   T &frac)
00147   {
00148   using namespace std;
00149   planck_assert((end-begin)>1,"sequence too small for interpolation");
00150   idx = lower_bound(begin,end,val,comp)-begin;
00151   if (idx>0) --idx;
00152   idx = min(tsize(end-begin-2),idx);
00153   frac = (val-begin[idx])/(begin[idx+1]-begin[idx]);
00154   }
00155 
00156 /*! Helper function for linear interpolation (or extrapolation).
00157     The array must be ordered in ascending order; no two values may be equal. */
00158 template<typename T, typename Iter> inline void interpol_helper
00159   (const Iter &begin, const Iter &end, const T &val, tsize &idx, T &frac)
00160   { interpol_helper (begin,end,val,std::less<T>(),idx,frac); }

00164 template<typename T> inline bool multiequal (const T &a, const T &b, const T &c)
00165   { return (a==b) && (a==c); }
00166 
00167 template<typename T> inline bool multiequal (const T &a, const T &b, const T &c,
00168   const T &d)
00169   { return (a==b) && (a==c) && (a==d); }
00170 
00171 template<typename T> inline bool multiequal (const T &a, const T &b, const T &c,
00172   const T &d, const T &e)
00173   { return (a==b) && (a==c) && (a==d) && (a==e); }
00174 
00175 template<typename T> inline bool multiequal (const T &a, const T &b, const T &c,
00176   const T &d, const T &e, const T &f)
00177   { return (a==b) && (a==c) && (a==d) && (a==e) && (a==f); }

00179 template<typename It, typename Comp> class IdxComp__
00180   {
00181   private:
00182     It begin;
00183     Comp comp;
00184   public:
00185     IdxComp__ (It begin_, Comp comp_): begin(begin_), comp(comp_) {}
00186     bool operator() (std::size_t a, std::size_t b) const
00187       { return comp(*(begin+a),*(begin+b)); }
00188   };

00190 /*! Performs an indirect sort on the supplied iterator range and returns in
00191     \a idx a \a vector containing the indices of the smallest, second smallest,
00192     third smallest, etc. element, according to \a comp. */
00193 template<typename It, typename T2, typename Comp>
00194   inline void buildIndex (It begin, It end, std::vector<T2> &idx, Comp comp)
00195   {
00196   using namespace std;
00197   T2 num=end-begin;
00198   idx.resize(num);
00199   for (T2 i=0; i<num; ++i) idx[i] = i;
00200   sort (idx.begin(),idx.end(),IdxComp__<It,Comp>(begin,comp));
00201   }
00202 
00203 /*! Performs an indirect sort on the supplied iterator range and returns in
00204     \a idx a \a vector containing the indices of the smallest, second smallest,
00205     third smallest, etc. element. */
00206 template<typename It, typename T2> inline void buildIndex (It begin, It end,
00207   std::vector<T2> &idx)
00208   {
00209   using namespace std;
00210   typedef typename iterator_traits<It>::value_type T;
00211   buildIndex(begin,end,idx,less<T>());
00212   }
00213 
00214 /*! Sorts the supplied iterator range according to the order given by \a idx.
00215     The operation is done out of place and requires temporary extra storage. */
00216 template<typename It, typename T2> inline void sortByIndex (It begin, It end,
00217   const std::vector<T2> &idx)
00218   {
00219   using namespace std;
00220   typedef typename iterator_traits<It>::value_type T;
00221   T2 num=end-begin;
00222   T *tmp= new T[num];
00223   for (T2 i=0; i<num; ++i) tmp[i]=*(begin+i);
00224   for (T2 i=0; i<num; ++i) *(begin+i) = tmp[idx[i]];
00225   delete[] tmp;
00226   }
00227 
00228 /*! Sorts the supplied iterator range according to the order given by \a idx.
00229     The operation is done in place. */
00230 template<typename It, typename T2> inline void sortByIndex_inplace
00231   (It begin, It end, const std::vector<T2> &idx)
00232   {
00233   using namespace std;
00234   typedef typename iterator_traits<It>::value_type T;
00235   T2 num=end-begin;
00236   vector<bool> done(num,false);
00237   T2 cnt=0;
00238   while (cnt<num)
00239     {
00240     if (!done[cnt]) // new cycle
00241       {
00242       T tmp(*(begin+cnt));
00243       T2 cnt2 = cnt;
00244       T2 cnt3 = idx[cnt];
00245       while (cnt3!=cnt)
00246         {
00247         done[cnt2]=true;
00248         *(begin+cnt2)=*(begin+cnt3);
00249         cnt2=cnt3;
00250         cnt3=idx[cnt3];
00251         }
00252       *(begin+cnt2) = tmp;
00253       }
00254     ++cnt;
00255     }
00256   }
00257 
00258 template<typename It, typename Comp> inline void indirectSort (It begin, It end,
00259   Comp comp)
00260   {
00261   using namespace std;
00262   typedef typename iterator_traits<It>::value_type T;
00263   vector<std::size_t> idx;
00264   buildIndex (begin,end,idx,comp);
00265   sortByIndex (begin,end,idx);
00266   }
00267 
00268 template<typename It> inline void indirectSort (It begin, It end)
00269   {
00270   using namespace std;
00271   typedef typename iterator_traits<It>::value_type T;
00272   indirectSort(begin,end,less<T>());
00273   }

00331 /*! Helper class for dividing a range of work items into chunks of specified
00332     size. */
00333 class chunkMaker
00334   {
00335   private:
00336     uint64 s_full, s_chunk, offset;
00337 
00338   public:
00339     /*! Creates an object that produces chunk information for \a s_full_
00340         work items and a desired chunk size of \a s_chunk_. */
00341     chunkMaker (uint64 s_full_, uint64 s_chunk_)
00342       : s_full(s_full_), s_chunk(s_chunk_), offset(0) {}
00343 
00344     /*! Returns the total number of chunks. */
00345     uint64 nchunks() const
00346       { return (s_full+s_chunk-1)/s_chunk; }
00347 
00348     /*! Returns the start index of the next chunk in \a start, and its size
00349         in \a size. If all chunks have been processed already, the return
00350         value is \a false, else \a true. */
00351     bool getNext (uint64 &start, uint64 &size)
00352       {
00353       using namespace std;
00354       if (offset>=s_full) return false;
00355       start=offset;
00356       size=min(s_chunk,s_full-offset);
00357       offset+=s_chunk;
00358       return true;
00359       }
00360   };

00364 template<typename T> void split (const std::string &inp, std::vector<T> &list);

00366 /*! Resizes \a container to zero and releases its memory. Typically used for
00367     std::vector.
00368     Taken from http://www.gotw.ca/gotw/054.htm */
00369 template<typename T> inline void releaseMemory (T &container)
00370   { T().swap(container); }
00371 
00372 /*! Releases all unused memory that \a container might have. Typically used for
00373     std::vector.
00374     Taken from http://www.gotw.ca/gotw/054.htm */
00375 template<typename T> inline void shrinkToFit (T &container)
00376   { T(container).swap(container); }
